Sentencas: The adsorption and diffusion properties of sulfur on the Ni/YSZ (yttrium-stabilized zirconia) are studied using density functional theory calculations with the particular focus on the influence of the oxygen vacancy at interface.
Titulo: The mechanism of sulfur poisoning on the nickel/yttrium-stabilized zirconia anode of solid oxide fuel cells: The role of the oxygen vacancy

Sentencas: It is found that the adsorbed sulfur does not favor to be located at the stoichiometric Ni/YSZ interface.
Titulo: The mechanism of sulfur poisoning on the nickel/yttrium-stabilized zirconia anode of solid oxide fuel cells: The role of the oxygen vacancy

Sentencas: Instead, it diffuses much easily away from the interface due to the repulsion between the formed S- and the interface O2-.
Titulo: The mechanism of sulfur poisoning on the nickel/yttrium-stabilized zirconia anode of solid oxide fuel cells: The role of the oxygen vacancy

Sentencas: With the formation of O vacancy at the Ni/YSZ interface, the diffusion direction of sulfur is reversed.
Titulo: The mechanism of sulfur poisoning on the nickel/yttrium-stabilized zirconia anode of solid oxide fuel cells: The role of the oxygen vacancy

Sentencas: The adsorbed S- diffuses back to the Ni/YSZ interface and is oxidized to S2- and trapped at the oxygen vacancy.
Titulo: The mechanism of sulfur poisoning on the nickel/yttrium-stabilized zirconia anode of solid oxide fuel cells: The role of the oxygen vacancy

Sentencas: Moreover, the trapped sulfur is very difficult to be removed by the fuel (e.g., H-2).
Titulo: The mechanism of sulfur poisoning on the nickel/yttrium-stabilized zirconia anode of solid oxide fuel cells: The role of the oxygen vacancy

Sentencas: The results would further our understanding on the mechanism of sulfur poisoning on the Ni/YSZ anode of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: The mechanism of sulfur poisoning on the nickel/yttrium-stabilized zirconia anode of solid oxide fuel cells: The role of the oxygen vacancy
